metadata.purpose: Provides instructions and a template for writing announcements that communicate product changes to VTEX users in a clear and actionable way.
metadata.usage: A template for communicating new features, product updates, or product deprecations to platform operators and users within the VTEX platform.

title.description: The title of the announcement, reflecting the product/feature and a concise, clear summary of the change or update. The summary should briefly describe the key change or improvement made to the product/feature.
title.example: VTEX Sales App: Improvements in the checkout experience

slug.description: A URL-friendly slug for the announcement
slug.validation_heuristic: Ensure that the slug is present, URL-friendly, and reflects the feature name.

synopsis.description: A brief, high-level summary of the announcement, providing users with key information at a glance.
synopsis.example: The VTEX Sales App has been updated to simplify the checkout process and improve customer data usage.
synopsis.template: <Brief summary of the feature and its benefit>
synopsis.validation_heuristic: Verify that the synopsis is present, concise (under 120 characters), and accurately summarizes the feature and its main user-facing benefit.

body.description: Confirm that the feature name and its main benefit are clearly stated, including availability (Alpha, Beta, GA, country-specific, etc.).
Check that it explains the previous process and how the feature changes or improves it.

body.section: Why did we make this change?
body.description: Ensure it explains the reasoning behind the change and lists at least one key benefit (preferably 3).
Verify that it clearly explains what the user needs to do to start using the feature, with actionable steps.
Confirm that there is a link or reference to further documentation, tracks, or help articles.

rules.description: Use clear, direct language without unnecessary adverbs or marketing speak
validation_heuristic: Flag unnecessary adverbs (e.g., 'simply', 'easily') in instructional content.

rules.description: Use active voice and direct language to enhance clarity
validation_heuristic: Flag passive constructions (e.g., 'is being done') in favor of active voice (e.g., 'we do').

rules.description: Avoid vague statements and excessive technical jargon
validation_heuristic: Flag vague terms (e.g., 'better', 'improved') without specific context.
Ensure technical terms are explained or linked to documentation.

rules.description: Use consistent terminology for features, modules, and menu names
validation_heuristic: Check for consistent use of product names and capitalization according to VTEX style guide.
Ensure error messages and UI elements match the platform exactly.

rules.description: Use present tense to describe existing features.
validation_heuristic: Scan for past or future tense verbs describing currently available functionality.

rules.description: Specify the scope of availability when describing features.
validation_heuristic: Check that documentation clearly states whether features are in Alpha, Beta, or GA.
Ensure regional or account-specific availability is mentioned where relevant.
